      This is the callback method, which is called by the HiveMQ core, if a client has sent, a CONNECT Message and was successfully authenticated.

    • Method Detail

      • priority

        public int priority()
        The priority is used when more than one OnConnectCallback is implemented to determine the order. If there is only one callback, which implements a certain interface, the priority has no effect.
        Specified by:
        priority in interface com.hivemq.spi.callback.SynchronousCallback
        Returns:
        callback priority

      • onConnect

        public void onConnect(com.hivemq.spi.message.CONNECT arg0,
             com.hivemq.spi.security.ClientData arg1)
               throws com.hivemq.spi.callback.exception.RefusedConnectionException
        This is the callback method, which is called by the HiveMQ core, if a client has sent, a CONNECT Message and was successfully authenticated. In this acme there is only a logging statement, normally the behavior would be implemented in here.
        Specified by:
        onConnect in interface com.hivemq.spi.callback.events.OnConnectCallback
        Parameters:
        connect - The CONNECT message from the client.
        clientData - Useful information about the clients authentication state and credentials.
        Throws:
        com.hivemq.spi.callback.exception.RefusedConnectionException - This exception should be thrown, if the client is not allowed to connect.
